intro.title: DMOD Document
intro.para: The DMOD (Digital Maintenance and Operations Data) document is a digital representation of maintenance and operations data for a specific system or equipment. The purpose of this document is to provide a clear and concise guide for the assembly, installation, and maintenance of the lighting system on a mountain bike.

systemDesc.title: System Description
systemDesc.para: The lighting system consists of two main components:

itemizedList.listItem: Front light
Rear light

systemDesc.para: Both lights are connected to a circuit breaker, which is installed on the handlebar.

preliminaryRqmts.title: Preliminary Requirements
preliminaryRqmts.para: Before starting the installation process, ensure that the following requirements are met:

itemizedList.listItem: The bike is stationary
The work area is clear and well-lit
All necessary tools and equipment are available

reqSupportEquips.title: Required Tools and Equipment
reqSupportEquips.para: The following tools and equipment are required for the installation process:

itemizedList.listItem: Specialist toolset (BSK-TLST-001)
Screwdriver
Protective strip
Clamp
Washer
Screw

procedure.title: Installation Procedure
procedure.para: The installation procedure consists of several steps, which must be followed in sequence.

proceduralStep.title: Step 1: Remove Packaging
proceduralStep.para: Remove the lighting system from its packaging and ensure that all components are included.

proceduralStep.title: Step 2: Install Front Light Fitting
proceduralStep.para: Install the front light fitting on the top of the handlebar.

itemizedList.listItem: Apply protective strip around the handlebar
Pull the clamp open and put it around the protective strip with the light connector at the top
Install the washer on the screw
Use the correct screwdriver from the specialist toolset and tighten the screw into the hole at the bottom of the clamp

proceduralStep.title: Step 3: Install Rear Light Fitting
proceduralStep.para: Install the rear light fitting to the rear triangle of the bike frame.

itemizedList.listItem: Apply protective strip around one of the two rear triangle up-tubes
Pull the clamp open and put it around the protective strip, making sure the light connector points rearwards
Install the washer on the screw
Use the correct screwdriver from the specialist toolset and tighten the screw into the hole at the bottom of the clamp

proceduralStep.title: Step 4: Connect Lights to Circuit Breaker
proceduralStep.para: Connect the lights to the circuit breaker.

itemizedList.listItem: Install the circuit breaker (CBLGT-1001-R) on the right-hand bike handlebar using the clamping ring
Connect the circuit breaker electrical wire to the rear connector of the front light
Attach the wire to the frame with protective strip
Install the circuit breaker (CBLGT-1001-L) on the left-hand bike handlebar using the clamping ring
Connect the circuit breaker electrical wire to the rear connector of the front light
Attach the wire to the frame with protective strip

closeRqmts.title: Closing Requirements
closeRqmts.para: After completing the installation process, ensure that the following requirements are met:

itemizedList.listItem: All tools and equipment are stored properly
The work area is clean and clear of debris
